result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus D Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 93 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Milwaukee County Case 13CF3153.  AMENDED 07-24-2015:  AND concurrent with Milwaukee County Case 13CM1033.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Marcus D Moore in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Justin Singleton.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 3.
Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 3:
Total Prison:  2 Years.
Initial Confinement: 18 Months.
Extended Supervision:  6 Months
93 Days Credit (from 12/16/14 - today's date).
Concurrent to:  Milwaukee County Cases 13CF3153.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and Follow Through as deemed appropriate by the agent.
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  
Victim listed in the Criminal Compliant.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

DNA Surcharge:  $200

Jury status hearing on March 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Marcus D Moore in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Justin Singleton.   
Speedy Trial Demand was made in commissioner's court on 12/26/14.

Atty. Singleton requests to withdraw the Speedy Trial Demand and presented statements to the court.
Defendant in agreement to the withdrawal of the speedy trial demand.
Court will allow the speedy trial demand to be withdrawn.
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on January 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Marcus D Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Justin Singleton.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Scott H. from the Village of Menomonee Falls was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Officer Joel F. from the Village of Butler was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defense counsel to go to the clerks office to get a court date before the Judge assigned, due to the Speedy Trial Demant being made. Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments. State objects to any bail modification. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed.
for a Speedy Trial filed by defendant.
